Reviewing Folder or Item Branching Behavior

At any time, you can determine whether a folder, file, or change request in a branch view is set to Branch on change (that is, its current branching behavior). Requirements, tasks, and topics never branch.

To determine the branching behavior for a specific folder or item:

  1. Select the folder or item.

  2. Highlight Advanced > Behavior from the Folder, File, or Change Request menu, as appropriate:

    3. The Branch on change check box may be:

    • Enabled and selected. With this setting, branching occurs when the item changes. The child item separates from its corresponding item in the parent view and receives a new revision number. (After the item has branched, the Branch on change check box becomes disabled.)

    • Enabled but not selected. In this situation, branching does not occur when you change the item.

      • If the view configuration floats, any changes to an item in the child view will be propagated to the corresponding item in the parent view (and possibly to other child views).

      • If the view configuration does not float, items in the child view cannot be changed because the corresponding item in the parent view cannot be changed. Therefore, the item is treated as though it were read-only (no data about the item can be changed).

    • Disabled. The check box may be disabled for a variety of reasons, including:

      • The item has already branched.

      • The item is in a reference view. Reference views do not permit branching, although some views of this type do allow items to change. Changes in a reference view item are automatically propagated to the corresponding item in the other view.

      • Branching makes no sense, given the time at which and the location to which the item was created, moved, shared, etc. For example, an item in a child view that has no corresponding item in the parent has no reason to branch.

      • The item may have been added to a blank branching view. Because this type of view is not derived from its parent view, it contains no items that correspond to those in the parent. Therefore, its branching behavior is disabled.

Note: To choose a different branching behavior, see Changing Folder or Item Branching Behavior.
